Git Joabe

  I implemented my self-hosted "Github".
  Me and my friend Natan decided to create a game project together, and use git for the source control. But a game project requires a lot of images, audios, etc., and this kind of file is much heavier than text files.
  That's why Git lfs exists, it can handle large files in a git repository, keeping it lightweight.
  Github already has support for git-lfs, but it comes with a price, so thats why i decided to store my own self-hosted code repository, so then me and my friend could have a lot of space available for using git-lfs (also, i could have an excuse for implementing new things in my home lab).
  Then i made my own fork of Gitbucket project, did a rollback to the 4.39 release, addedd some customization, and implemented in my home server.
  And that's it.
